plugins.name: Selemander Edit
plugins.description:
This plug-in provides useful functions such as reordering multi-selected items, enlarging and shrinking selections, automatically selecting items by name, deleting, and flipping the order.

이 플러그인은 선택한 여러 항목의 순서 변경, 선택 확대 및 축소, 이름을 통한 항목 자동 선택, 삭제, 순서 뒤집기 등 유용한 기능을 제공합니다.


### Short cut (If the plug-in window is enabled) ###

### 단축키 (플러그인 포커스 상태에서 동작) ###

  1. [Shift + Enter]: Enter the entered text into the selected text items. / 입력된 텍스트로 선택된 텍스트 항목에 입력
  2. [.] : Select the next item / 다음 항목 선택
  3. [,] : Select previous item / 이전 항목 선택
  4. [Shift + .]: Expand your selection to the previous item / 이전 항목을 선택에 추가합니다.
  5. [Shift + ,]: Expand your selection to the next item / 다음 항목을 선택에 추가합니다.
  6. [Left Arrow ←] : Move the selected items to the left / 선택된 항목들을 이전으로 이동
  7. [Right Arrow →] : Move the selected items to the right / 선택된 항목들을 다음으로 이동
  8. [Home] : Move to First / 첫번째 항목 선택
  9. [End] : Move to Last / 마지막 항목 선택
  10. [Delete, Backspace] : Delete selected items / 선택 항목들 삭제
  11. [Shift + s] : Swap between two texts / 선택된 두 텍스트 항목의 내용 바꾸기
  12. [Shift + r] : Reverse the selected items / 선택 항목의 순서를 뒤집기
  13. [-] : Unselect the last of the selections / 선택 항목들 중 마지막 항목을 선택 제거
  14. [Shift + -] : Unselect the first of the selections / 선택 항목들 중 첫번째 항목을 선택 제거
  15. [Shift + 1] : Select odd number items / 홀수 항목을 선택
  16. [Shift + 2] : Select even number items / 짝수 항목을 선택
plugins.tagline: Multi Selection & text controler for autolayout

plugins.name: Universal Design (beta)
plugins.description:
UDML Exporter for Figma (beta)


Transform your Figma designs into AI-ready UDML (Universal Design Markup Language) documents. UDML Exporter creates structured, semantic descriptions of your designs specifically optimized for AI interpretation and code generation.


AI-First Design Documentation


UDML is built from the ground up to be understood by AI. Instead of trying to directly convert designs to code (which often produces messy, unmaintainable results), UDML provides AI agents with:


  1. Semantic Structure: Clear representation of layout hierarchies and relationships
  2. Design Context: Comprehensive documentation of components and their usage
  3. Style System: Organized design tokens and variables
  4. Asset Catalog: Structured references to exported graphics and icons
  5. Rich Metadata: Layer names, descriptions, and relationships that AI can interpret


Why AI + UDML?


Traditional Figma-to-code tools try to guess what components you meant to create. UDML takes a different approach:


  1. Let AI Do the Heavy Lifting: Instead of making assumptions, provide AI with rich context
  2. Semantic Understanding: AI can interpret layer names and relationships to generate appropriate components
  3. Design System Integration: AI can map your design tokens to existing system variables
  4. Framework Flexibility: Generate code for any framework or library
  5. Open and Extensible: No locked-in formats or proprietary solutions


How It Works


  1. Design in Figma using Auto Layout and components
  2. Export to UDML (optimized for AI consumption)
  3. Provide the UDML to an AI agent (like Claude or Cursor)
  4. Get clean, semantic code that matches your design system


Example AI Interpretation


<!-- UDML Export -->
<column name="user-profile-card" gap="16px">
<image name="avatar" src="assets/user-avatar.png"/>
<text name="user-name" typography="heading-medium">John Doe</text>
<text name="user-title" typography="body-regular">Senior Designer</text>
</column>


AI might interpret this as:


<!-- React Interpretation -->
<UserCard>
<Avatar src={user.avatar} />
<Heading level={3}>{user.name}</Heading>
<Text>{user.title}</Text>
</UserCard>


Perfect For


  1. Designers who want AI to understand their work
  2. Developers who need intelligent code generation
  3. Teams building or maintaining design systems
  4. Anyone looking for an alternative to traditional Figma-to-code tools


Getting Started


  1. Install the plugin
  2. Design with AI interpretation in mind
  3. Export to UDML
  4. Let AI generate your code


Design for AI


To get the best results:

  1. Use clear, descriptive layer names
  2. Leverage Auto Layout for clear structure
  3. Create consistent component patterns
  4. Document your design system tokens


Join the AI-First Design Movement


UDML is an open specification for AI-friendly design documentation. Help shape the future of AI-assisted design-to-code workflows.


docs.universaldesign.ai
plugins.tagline: Figma to code, your way

plugins.name: Lighthouse
plugins.description:
Lighthouse helps designers check Lottie animation compatibility across iOS, Android, and Web. It scans Figma frames, detects unsupported features like shadows, blurs, etc., and lists issues directly on affected layers. Double-click to jump to problem layers and get instant updates as you fix them—ensuring a smooth animation workflow.


How to Use Lighthouse:

1️⃣ Select a Frame – Open Lighthouse and choose a frame to analyze.

2️⃣ Instant Issue Detection – View a list of unsupported animation features.

3️⃣ Quick Fix Navigation – Double-click an issue to select the affected layer.

4️⃣ Live Updates – Changes update instantly as you fix issues.

5️⃣ Final Check & Export – Ensure compatibility for seamless Lottie animations.

6️⃣ Mark frames – Mark frames that are ready for animation to avoid confusion and ensure efficient workflow.


Simplify your motion design process with Lighthouse! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Instantly detect unsupported Lottie features in Figma for seamless cross-platform animations.

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer for Figma


Plugin for finding and replacing text in layer and variable names, with automatic naming convention conversion.


Features


  1. Layer renaming: Quickly find and replace text in layer names
  2. Layer type filtering: frames, text, components, images, etc.
  3. Variable support: find and replace in variable names
  4. Flexible filtering options for variables: search by full name, path only, or name only
  5. Auto-renaming: Convert layer names to different naming conventions automatically
  6. Naming conventions: Support for camelCase, PascalCase, snake_case, kebab-case, flatcase, dotcase, and spacecase
  7. Live preview: See how names will look before applying changes
  8. Revert functionality: Restore original names after renaming
  9. Dot case support: Special support for CSS class-style naming with leading dots (.class-name)


How to use


For layers:


1. Select the "Layers" tab

2. Choose the layer types to search

3. Enter text to find

4. Enter text to replace

5. Enable/disable case sensitivity

6. Click "Rename"

7. If needed, click "Revert" to restore original names


Auto-renaming:


1. Select the "Auto" tab

2. Choose the layer types to rename

3. Select the desired naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, etc.)

4. See the live preview of how names will be converted

5. Click "Rename" to apply the changes

6. If needed, click "Revert" to restore original names


For variables:


1. Select the "Variables" tab

2. Choose the search filter:

- All - search the entire variable name

- Path - search only in the path (all parts before the last "/")

- Name - search only in the name (part after the last "/")

3. Enter text to find

4. Enter text to replace

5. Enable/disable case sensitivity

6. Click "Rename"


Troubleshooting


If the plugin cannot find variables:

1. Make sure there are variables in the file

2. Check that variables are available on the current page

3. Try restarting the plugin

4. Ensure that your Figma version supports variables


If auto-renaming doesn't work as expected:

1. Note that auto-renaming currently works only for layers, not for variables

2. Make sure you've selected the correct layer types to rename

3. If you need to undo changes, use the "Revert" button

plugins.name: Any Variables Import (变量导入)
plugins.description:
You don't need to prepare or clean the variables from unnecessary symbols; simply copy the code as it is, and the plugin will automatically find and import all the variables


Key Features:

• Universal Import: Supports colors, numbers, strings, and booleans

• Flexible Collections: Create new variable sets or update existing ones

• Includes support for variable modes

• Wide Compatibility: Works with CSS, LESS, and SASS syntax

• Comprehensive Color Format Support:

Standard formats: HEX, RGB/RGBA, HSL/HSLA, HSB/HSBA

Modern formats: HWB, LCH, LAB, Display-P3

• Intuitive Interface: Includes clear examples for all variable types

• Real-Time Feedback: Visual progress tracking and detailed import summary

• Supports Chinese and Spanish languages.


Note: Currently, the plugin copies values from referenced variables rather than creating actual variable references in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Easily import CSS, LESS, SASS variables into Figma—colors, numbers, strings, and booleans.

plugins.name: Stellar - Streamline Your Design Handoff
plugins.description:
Stellar 🚀 empowers you to create organized and professional documentation for your design handoff. With four robust tools, you can structure your Figma files in a clean and intuitive manner.


Frame Identifier - Ideal for pinpointing specific screens or components.

Easily create clear headers to identify individual frames:

  1. Select any frame or group of elements.
  2. Add a title and subtitle.
  3. A polished header will be generated above your selection, enhancing clarity and organization.


Section Identifier - Perfect for grouping features or user flows.

Organize related frames with cohesive section headers:

  1. Select multiple frames that belong together.
  2. Add a section title and description.
  3. A header will be created that spans across all selected frames, providing a unified view.


Flow Identifier - Essential for tracking progress and communicating state.

Document your navigation flows with intuitive status indicators:

  1. Select frames within your user flow.
  2. Add a title and description.
  3. Choose a status (e.g., In Progress, Ready for Development).
  4. Status tags are color-coded and include helpful icons, making it easy to convey the current state.



Connector Arrows - Connect your frames with intelligent arrows.

Seamlessly link frames with dynamic arrows:

  1. Select two or more frames to connect.
  2. Choose from 4 arrow styles: Default Arrow (clean and simple), Success Arrow (positive flows), Error Arrow (error states), Dashed Arrow (alternative paths).
  3. Toggle between light and dark modes for optimal visibility.
  4. Arrows automatically adjust to frame positions, ensuring a tidy and logical layout.


Perfect for:

  1. Design Systems
  2. User Flow Documentation
  3. Development Handoff
  4. Project Status Tracking
  5. Team Collaboration



Start organizing your Figma files with Stellar and create documentation that both designers and developers will appreciate! 🚀🚀🚀
plugins.tagline: Streamline your design handoff with organized headers, sections, and smart connectors

plugins.name: Consistify
plugins.description:
With the Consistify plugin, you can be be able to:


Detect Design Inconsistencies: Scan multiple frames for discrepancies in font styles, colors, buttons, iconography(coming soon), spacing, and navigation elements(coming soon) etc.


Get Visual Feedback: Receive clear, color-coded tags indicating inconsistencies, with direct frame references and numerical comparisons for easy analysis.


Streamline Workflow(coming soon): Highlight design issues directly in the UI, allowing users to click and focus on problematic frames, helping maintain design system integrity across projects.


To use the Consistify plugin, follow these steps:


Open your design in Figma.

Select at least 2 frames you want to compare for inconsistencies.

Run the Plugin


Advanced Features(coming son:


Accessibility Checker: Analyze contrast ratios in real-time for WCAG compliance.

Component Management: Identify duplicate components and track usage statistics.


Design System Health Monitoring: Flag inconsistent color usage, manual overrides on text styles, and mismatched font sizes.


The plugin is a must-have tool for ensuring cohesive, well-structured designs while saving time on manual checks.

accepted.name: Nyekachi Wihioka
accepted.description: Product Designer passionate about creating seamless, user-centered experiences. Building tools that empower designers to work smarter and faster.

plugins.name: get-antd-token
plugins.description:
# get-antd-token - Ant Design Token 匹配工具


## 简介


get-antd-token 是一个专为设计师和开发者打造的 Figma 插件，帮助您快速匹配 Figma 设计元素与 Ant Design 的设计 Token，实现无缝的设计与开发协作。


## 主要功能


- 🎨 **精准颜色匹配**：选择任意元素，即时获取对应的 Ant Design 颜色 Token

- 💧 **半透明颜色识别**：智能识别半透明颜色，并提供 `rgba(token.colorXXX, 0.x)` 格式的替代方案

- 🔍 **边框与内边距识别**：自动检测元素的圆角和内边距，匹配相应的 borderRadius 和 padding Token

- 📝 **模板管理系统**：支持导入/导出 Token 模板，完全兼容 Ant Design 的主题配置文件

- 🔄 **一键复制**：快速复制 Token 值，轻松粘贴到代码中


## 插件优势


- **提高设计开发效率**：不再需要手动查找颜色代码或测量边距

- **保持设计一致性**：确保使用 Ant Design 官方推荐的 Token

- **简化设计交接**：设计师可以直接提供 Token 名称而非色值

- **支持主题切换**：通过模板管理轻松在不同主题间切换
plugins.tagline: 支持选中figma的元素获取到antd主题色对应的token值

Simple plugin to synchronise translations with strings repository. Allows to push and pull translations from your own server. Works with active selection to speedup parsing processes.


Usage:

Enter connection details and press connect button.

After selection of element press "refresh selection" to get text labels from selection.

Press "pull" to fetch translations from remote server.

Press "apply" to apply translations from selected translations to document selection.

Press "push" to send translations to remote server.

plugins.name: Class Action
plugins.description:
Class Action is a powerful CSS-like styling tool that revolutionizes how designers work with consistent design tokens and variables in Figma. Create Tailwind-inspired class libraries, UI kits, and design templates with ease, then apply saved styles instantly to other frames with a single click.


Key features:

  1. Create and manage reusable style classes similar to CSS and Tailwind classes
  2. Build and apply complete UI kits and design templates across multiple frames
  3. Preserve Figma variables, color tokens, and style references in your templates
  4. Full support for Tailwind-like utility classes, component styles, and design tokens
  5. Premium version with unlimited style classes and advanced template management


Class Action brings CSS and Tailwind-inspired workflows to Figma by eliminating repetitive styling tasks. Perfect for design systems, UI kit creation, template libraries, and maintaining visual consistency across projects. Save time, reduce styling errors, and keep your designs perfectly aligned with your component library or Tailwind-like system.


Compatible with both light and dark Figma themes, supports variable tokens for responsive templates, and optimized for performance even in large UI kit files with complex component libraries.
plugins.tagline: Think as a designer, act like a developer.

131875.release_notes:
This update focuses on infrastructure improvements and codebase optimizations to prepare for upcoming Figma features. We've enhanced our diagnostic system with comprehensive logging and improved our architecture to better support future grid layouts once they're fully accessible via the Figma API.

New in this release:
• Enhanced debug logging system for better diagnostics and troubleshooting
• Architectural improvements for future CSS Grid compatibility
• Standardized notification system with clearer user feedback
• Optimized code structure for handling beta Figma features
• Improved documentation and developer resources

These foundational improvements ensure Class Action will be ready to integrate the latest Figma features as soon as they become available in the official API. My commitment remains to provide reliable, high-quality tools that enhance your Figma workflow.
131875.tagline: Think as a designer, act like a developer.

plugins.name: Figma to Storyteq
plugins.description:
Turn your Figma designs into Storyteq dynamic editable ads.


The Figma to Storyteq Plugin enables designers to effortlessly export their Figma designs into Storyteq, turning static visuals into dynamic and customizable ad templates.


Streamline your workflow and scale content production with ease.


  1. Efficient Export – Quickly send your Figma designs to Storyteq in just a few clicks.
  2. Dynamic Template Creation – Convert static designs into adaptable templates ready for automation with Storyteq’s Ad Engine.
  3. User-Friendly Interface – Intuitive, seamless integration between Figma and Storyteq.


How It Works


  1. Design in Figma – Create your visuals as usual.
  2. Export via Plugin – Use the Figma to Storyteq Plugin to send Figma designs to Storyteq.
  3. Customize in Storyteq – Modify and manage your dynamic templates for automated content creation.


Use Cases


  1. Marketing Campaigns – Develop adaptable templates for various assets.
  2. Brand Consistency – Ensure design uniformity across platforms.
  3. Rapid Prototyping – Quickly generate dynamic versions of design concepts.



Getting Started


To begin transforming your static designs into dynamic ad templates, download the Figma to Storyteq Plugin today. This tool is exclusively available for users with an active Storyteq license. Follow these simple steps to integrate your designs with Storyteq:


  1. Sign up for Storyteq if you haven't already.
  2. Run the Storyteq Plugin within Figma.
  3. Authenticate your Storyteq account by logging in.
  4. Follow the plugin’s steps to export and customize your designs.


About


Storyteq helps global brands deliver content faster with the power of automation. Bring teams together to create pixel-perfect campaigns on brand, on time and on budget across markets and channels.


✔ Save Time – Reduce manual work and speed up content production.


✔ Ensure Consistency – Maintain brand integrity across multiple variations.


✔ Scale Easily – Automate and update templates effortlessly in Storyteq.
plugins.tagline: Turn your Figma designs into dynamic editable ads in Storyteq.

plugins.name: PixelTweak
plugins.description:
PixelTweak is a simple yet powerful tool that helps you achieve pixel-perfect design. It smooths edges, rounds numbers, and aligns elements with just one click.


  1. Select your layers – Choose the layer or layers you want to perfect
  2. Hit the Tweak button – One click is all it takes to activate the magic!
  3. Watch the transformation – PixelTweak goes to work, smoothing out edges, rounding numbers, and aligning everything for a sleek, professional finish. It doesn’t just stop at the selected layers—it fine-tunes every child element for complete perfection.
plugins.tagline: Achieve pixel-perfect precision with a single click

plugins.name: PropSelect
plugins.description:
PropSelect enhances your Figma workflow by allowing you to copy and paste specific properties like fill, stroke, and corner radius between elements without overwriting all properties.


Here is a YouTube video summarizing the features and working of this plugin - https://youtu.be/76v9z9xthH0


How it works:

1. Select an element: Click on an element in your design, and its properties will appear in the plugin UI.

2. Choose properties to copy: For each property (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius), you can select a checkbox to indicate which properties you want to copy. Once you're done, click the copy button to save the selected properties.

3. Paste properties: You can paste the copied properties onto one or more elements at once.


Features:

• Selective property copying: Choose exactly which properties to copy (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius) to avoid overwriting unwanted styles.

• Multi-object pasting: Apply copied properties to multiple objects simultaneously, saving time when working with multiple elements.

• Compatibility with other methods: You can paste properties copied outside of the plugin directly. Copying properties within plugin will not override that.

• Undo support: Easily undo your last action if something goes wrong.


Tips:

• Use PropSelect to quickly replicate specific properties across multiple objects without affecting other styles.

• Perfect for maintaining consistency in your design while only changing the properties you care about.

• Works well for batch edits where you want to adjust specific properties, like color or stroke width, across many elements.


Known issues:

• Does not copy underline properties or text alignment.

• Will not work on text boxes with different properties applied to individual contents.
plugins.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of an element

plugins.name: Condens
plugins.description:
With the Condens plugin, you can quickly import highlights from Condens into FigJam. This keeps your insights intact, preserving key details like participant names and links back to the original data.


Perfect for brainstorming, organizing ideas, and running synthesis workshops with your team — without losing the context behind your research, even when switching between tools.


How it works:

  1. Export your highlights from Condens as a CSV file.
  2. Open the Condens plugin in FigJam and upload the CSV file.
  3. Your Highlights are instantly converted into sticky notes, complete with the respondent’s name and a direct link back to the original data in Condens, ready to use in your FigJam board.


Contact us for support, book a demo to get a personalized walkthrough, or visit our Help Center for more information.

If you're not using Condens yet, start your free 15-day trial at condens.io.
plugins.tagline: Import Highlights from Condens into Figjam

plugins.name: Figma to JSON Exporter
plugins.description:
Figma to JSON Exporter is a powerful plugin that converts your Figma designs into comprehensive, structured JSON data. Perfect for designers and developers who need to extract detailed design information for documentation, analysis, or development workflows.


✨ Key Features:

Complete Design Extraction - Captures all visual properties, layout data, typography, and component information

Dual Mode Support - Works seamlessly in both Design and Dev modes within Figma

Structured Output - Generates clean, organized JSON with design tokens and component hierarchy

Developer-Friendly - Perfect for integration with Visual Studio Code and other development tools

Comprehensive Data - Includes colors, fonts, spacing, effects, Auto Layout properties, and component relationships


🔧 Use Cases:

Design Documentation - Create detailed design system documentation

Development Handoff - Bridge design-to-code workflows

Design Analysis - Analyze and audit existing designs

Tool Integration - Import design data into custom development tools

Design System Management - Extract and organize design tokens


🎨 How It Works:

Simply select any design element in Figma and export its complete structure as a downloadable JSON file. The plugin extracts every detail from individual components to complex nested layouts, making it easy to understand and recreate designs programmatically.

Compatible with Figma Design Mode, Dev Mode, and perfect for Visual Studio Code integration.
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma designs into structured JSON data

plugins.name: Dummy Details Filler
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you populate your designs with dummy data. Unlike other data generators, this plugin gives you precise control over your generated content through customizable options for each data type. This is perfect for mockups, prototypes, and design presentations.


Data Types:

  1. Generate various types of realistic data:
  2. Full Names (International names from different cultures)
  3. Usernames (Customizable patterns)
  4. Email Addresses (Custom domains and formats)
  5. Phone Numbers (US, UK, France, Germany, Sri Lanka formats)
  6. Physical Addresses
  7. Company Names
  8. Job Titles
  9. Dates (Short, Long, ISO, European formats)
  10. Numbers (Custom ranges)
  11. Lorem Ipsum (Custom length)
  12. Passwords (Adjustable length and complexity)
  13. File Names (Various types and extensions)
  14. Domain Names
  15. IP Addresses
  16. Color Codes (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  17. Zip/Postal Codes (US, UK, Canada formats)
  18. Cities (Global selection)
  19. Countries
  20. UUID
  21. Prices (Multiple currencies and formats)
  22. Account Numbers
  23. Currency Symbols & Codes
  24. URL-friendly Slugs


Each data type comes with its own set of customization options, allowing you to generate exactly the kind of data you need for your designs. Whether you're creating a simple contact list or a complex dashboard, Dummy Details Filler helps you create more realistic and meaningful mockups quickly and efficiently.


Made with ❤️ by Yasir Ahamad
plugins.tagline: Fill your designs with dummy data instantly with more control!

plugins.name: Ungroup with BG
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to ungroup frames while preserving their background colors, corner radius, and strokes. When you ungroup a frame that has background styles, the plugin automatically creates a rectangle with the same styles at the same layer position.


Features:

• Preserves background colors and opacity

• Maintains corner radius settings

• Keeps stroke styles

• Retains the original layer position

• Automatically selects the new background and ungrouped elements


背景色やストロークが設定されたフレームをグループ解除する際に、それらのスタイルを保持するプラグインです。背景スタイルを持つフレームをグループ解除すると、自動的に同じスタイルの四角形が同じレイヤー位置に作成されます。


機能：

• 背景色と不透明度を保持

• 角丸の設定を維持

• ストロークスタイルを保持

• 元のレイヤー位置を維持

• 新しい背景と解除された要素を自動選択
